intro: Crotalaria steudneri, commonly known as the yellow rattle, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers and distinctive, inflated seed pods. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. It has a taproot system and produces small, hairy leaves that help it conserve water. Crotalaria steudneri is also known for its role in ecological systems, as its seeds are an important food source for various bird species.
